study_hacks.name: The Pomodoro Technique
study_hacks.description: Study for 25 minutes, then take a 5-minute break. Repeat this cycle four times, then take a longer break. This helps improve focus and productivity.

study_hacks.name: Teach What You Learn
study_hacks.description: Explaining concepts to someone else or even just out loud to yourself reinforces your understanding and retention.

study_hacks.name: Use Feynman’s Technique
study_hacks.description: Try to explain a concept in simple terms as if you were teaching it to a child. If you can do this successfully, it means you've mastered the material.

study_hacks.name: Mind Mapping
study_hacks.description: Create a visual diagram that links key ideas and concepts. This method helps in better understanding and recalling information.

study_hacks.name: Flashcards with Spaced Repetition
study_hacks.description: Use apps like Anki or physical flashcards to study with spaced repetition, which helps with long-term retention of information.

study_hacks.name: Study in Multiple Locations
study_hacks.description: Changing your study environment can improve information retention and prevent your brain from associating learning with just one place.

study_hacks.name: Chew Gum While Studying and During the Exam
study_hacks.description: Chewing the same flavor of gum while studying and during an exam can help you recall information due to context-dependent memory.

life_hacks.name: Two-Minute Rule
life_hacks.description: If something can be done in two minutes or less, do it immediately. This keeps tasks from piling up and reduces procrastination.

life_hacks.name: Digital Declutter
life_hacks.description: Organize your desktop and phone to minimize distractions. Use folders and keep only essential apps and files on the home screen.

life_hacks.name: Meal Prepping
life_hacks.description: Plan and prepare your meals for the week on Sundays. This saves time, reduces stress, and helps you maintain a healthy diet.

life_hacks.name: Use White Noise for Better Sleep
life_hacks.description: Apps like Rain Rain or simply a fan can create white noise, which helps in blocking out disturbances and improving sleep quality.

life_hacks.name: One-Minute Rule for Tidying Up
life_hacks.description: Spend just one minute tidying up every time you leave a room. This small effort can keep your living space consistently clean.

life_hacks.name: Save Time by Bundling Tasks
life_hacks.description: Combine small, similar tasks together (like making all your phone calls at once) to increase efficiency.

life_hacks.name: Learn Keyboard Shortcuts
life_hacks.description: Whether it's for your computer, phone, or favorite apps, keyboard shortcuts can save you hours in the long run.

fun_facts.fact: The Eiffel Tower Can Grow Taller
fun_facts.description: Due to thermal expansion, the Eiffel Tower can grow by about 6 inches during the summer.
Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still perfectly edible.

fun_facts.fact: Bananas Are Berries, But Strawberries Aren't
fun_facts.description: Botanically, bananas qualify as berries, while strawberries do not.

fun_facts.fact: Your Brain Uses 20% of Your Body’s Energy
fun_facts.description: Even though the brain is only about 2% of your body weight, it consumes 20% of the energy your body uses.

fun_facts.fact: A Day on Venus is Longer Than a Year on Venus
fun_facts.description: Venus takes longer to rotate on its axis than it does to complete one orbit of the sun.
The heart of a blue whale is so large that a human could swim through its arteries.
